result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arthur James Amend

defendant.name: Amend, Arthur James

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Arthur James Amend in court.  Attorney David Allan Nelson in court for Arthur James Amend.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Reading of Information waived; NG plea entered.  Counsel req ad - resolution expected but restitution needs to be addressed. Court admonishes def and adj.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Arthur James Amend in court.  Attorney David Allan Nelson in court for Arthur James Amend.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def, accepts waiver and binds def over; State to file Information.
Arraignment scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Arthur James Amend in court. Victim present.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def req court appointed counsel.  Court appoints Atty Nelson.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $200 per month commencing 8-15-22. Court sets $1500 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear w/an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 09:45 am.
